bug.short_desc: Scrolling on drag session does not work if drag able widget is a parent of the scroll container

long_desc.thetext:
Mind you have to set draggable property on a widget which is not extended from AbstractScroller. Further more mind there is no parent of your drag able widget which extends from abstract widget.
You will see that scrolling will not work on a drag session.
Recommended that scrolling on drag session, however.
Please notice, that the current implementation of MDragDropScrolling does scroll multiple times if scroll container are nested.

Adding the MDragDropScrolling mixin to the container is solving this issue in the demo.
I think this is the right option for the application, too.
Created attachment 1334 This example will point you to the unwanted behavior, that a scroll area will not scroll on drag session if the drag able widget is beside the scroll area.
I tried the solution from Alex. But as you can see on the newly attached demo, the surrounding container will be drag able, however.
Created attachment 1338 Scrollinf on drag session; but unwanted behavior

Would you please re think about moving the implementation from MDragDropScrolling to a singleton or a handler?
This would solve the problem and would be a much modular way.
If you would choose a singleton the user could decide to activate the behavior by just calling the instance once in his code.
If you would desire a handler we could require it only if scroll areas are used.

Added a wrapper for the mixin to be able to activate "scroll on drag session" for any widget. This widget will be the root whose children will have this feature.
new class: qx.ui.core.DragDropScrolling
examples:
new qx.ui.core.DragDropScrolling(); // binds scroll on drag session capability on application root
new qx.ui.core.DragDropScrolling(new qx.ui.core.Widget()); // binds scroll on drag session capability on explicit widget, all of its children will have the capability

committed on master: 993d16aa1def5c3171ed741f4a0d26ef49dd0054
Currently the deprecation strategy is not clear for me, I will wait for feedback from Martin.

Checked the commit and it reads good.
(In reply to comment #9) > Currently the deprecation strategy is not clear for me, I will wait for > feedback from Martin.
As the mixin is still in place the same way it was before, there is no migration / deprecation needed at the moment. But the AbstractScrollArea and the Table do still include the mixin which might not be necessary anymore. On the other hand, there is no harm if we keep it. So my suggestion is to keep everything the way it is now and pass the deprecation.

attachment.desc: This example will point you to the unwanted behavior, that a scroll area will not scroll on drag session if the drag able widget is beside the scroll area.
Scrollinf on drag session; but unwanted behavior
